`,(0,a.jsx)(e.p,{children:"Taj Mahal: Built by Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal, the Taj Mahal is an exquisite white marble mausoleum and a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is renowned for its stunning architecture, intricate marble inlay work, and symmetrical gardens. The Taj Mahal is considered one of the Seven Wonders of the World."}),`
`]}),`
`,(0,a.jsxs)(e.li,{children:[`
`,(0,a.jsx)(e.p,{children:"Agra Fort: Another UNESCO World Heritage Site, Agra Fort is a massive red sandstone fortification built by Emperor Akbar in the 16th century. It served as the main residence of the Mughal emperors until Shah Jahan shifted the capital to Delhi. The fort encompasses several palaces, mosques, and courtyards."}),`
`]}),`
`,(0,a.jsxs)(e.li,{children:[`
`,(0,a.jsx)(e.p,{children:"Fatehpur Sikri: Located just outside of Agra, Fatehpur Sikri is a well-preserved ancient city constructed by Emperor Akbar in the 16th century. It served as the capital of the Mughal Empire for a brief period before being abandoned due to water scarcity. The site is famous for its impressive architecture and historical significance."}),`
`]}),`
`,(0,a.jsxs)(e.li,{children:[`
`,(0,a.jsx)(e.p,{children:`Itmad-ud-Daulah's Tomb: Also known as the "Baby Taj," this exquisite tomb is often regarded as a draft of the Taj Mahal. It was built by Empress Nur Jahan in memory of her father and features intricate marble work and beautiful gardens.`}),`
`]}),`
`,(0,a.jsxs)(e.li,{children:[`
`,(0,a.jsx)(e.p,{children:"Mehtab Bagh: Situated across the Yamuna River from the Taj Mahal, Mehtab Bagh is a charbagh complex known for its stunning views of the Taj Mahal. It is a popular spot for photography and leisurely walks."}),`
`]}),`

`]}),`
`]}),`

`,(0,i.jsxs)(e.li,{children:[`
`,(0,i.jsx)(e.p,{children:"Delhi, officially known as the National Capital Territory of Delhi (NCT), is a city and a union territory of India. It serves as the capital of India and is one of the largest and most populous cities in the country. Delhi is located in the northern part of India and is bordered by the state of Haryana on three sides and by Uttar Pradesh to the east."}),`
`]}),`
`,(0,i.jsxs)(e.li,{children:[`
`,(0,i.jsx)(e.p,{children:"Delhi has a rich history dating back thousands of years, with evidence of settlements from the 6th century BCE. It has been the capital of several empires and dynasties, including the Maurya, Gupta, and Mughal empires. The city is known for its numerous historical monuments, including the Red Fort, Qutub Minar, Humayun's Tomb, and India Gate, which attract tourists from around the world."}),`
`]}),`
`,(0,i.jsxs)(e.li,{children:[`
`,(0,i.jsx)(e.p,{children:"Today, Delhi is a major political, cultural, and commercial hub of India. It is divided into two parts: Old Delhi, which reflects the city's historical heritage with its narrow lanes, ancient bazaars, and Mughal-era monuments, and New Delhi, which serves as the capital's modern administrative center with wide avenues, government buildings, and diplomatic enclaves."}),`
`]}),`
`,(0,i.jsxs)(e.li,{children:[`
`,(0,i.jsx)(e.p,{children:"Delhi is also known for its diverse culture, with a mix of different languages, cuisines, religions, and traditions. It is a melting pot of various cultures from across India, making it a vibrant and dynamic city."}),`
`]}),`
`]}),`

`,(0,i.jsxs)(a.li,{children:[`
`,(0,i.jsx)(a.p,{children:"City Palace: A grand palace complex that houses several museums showcasing royal artifacts and textiles."}),`
`]}),`
`,(0,i.jsxs)(a.li,{children:[`
`,(0,i.jsx)(a.p,{children:"Amber Fort: Located just outside the city, this majestic fort offers panoramic views of the surrounding landscape and features beautiful palaces, gardens, and temples."}),`
`]}),`
`,(0,i.jsxs)(a.li,{children:[`
`,(0,i.jsx)(a.p,{children:"Jantar Mantar: An astronomical observatory built in the 18th century, which contains a collection of architectural astronomical instruments."}),`
`]}),`
`,(0,i.jsxs)(a.li,{children:[`

`]}),`
`,(0,i.jsxs)(a.li,{children:[`
`,(0,i.jsx)(a.p,{children:"Nahargarh Fort: Another hilltop fort offering panoramic views of Jaipur, especially stunning at sunset."}),`
`]}),`
`,(0,i.jsxs)(a.li,{children:[`

`]}),`

`,(0,e.jsx)(a.p,{children:"Manali is a popular hill station nestled in the mountains of the Indian state of Himachal Pradesh. It is situated in the Kullu district at an altitude of around 2,050 meters (6,726 feet) above sea level. Known for its breathtaking natural beauty, lush green valleys, snow-capped peaks, and meandering rivers, Manali is a favored destination for tourists, honeymooners, and adventure enthusiasts."}),`

`,(0,e.jsx)(a.p,{children:"Rohtang Pass: This high mountain pass, located about 51 kilometers from Manali, offers stunning views of the surrounding mountains and valleys. It's a popular destination for snow activities during the winter months."}),`
`]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(a.li,{children:[`
`,(0,e.jsx)(a.p,{children:"Hadimba Temple: Dedicated to Hadimba Devi, wife of Bhima from the Indian epic Mahabharata, this ancient temple is known for its unique architecture and serene surroundings."}),`
`]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(a.li,{children:[`
`,(0,e.jsx)(a.p,{children:"Old Manali: Known for its hippie culture, cafes, and vibrant atmosphere, Old Manali offers a more laid-back experience compared to the bustling streets of New Manali."}),`
`]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(a.li,{children:[`
`,(0,e.jsx)(a.p,{children:"Vashisht Hot Springs: Situated around 6 kilometers from Manali, these natural hot water springs are believed to have medicinal properties and are frequented by tourists seeking relaxation."}),`
`]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(a.li,{children:[`
`,(0,e.jsx)(a.p,{children:"Great Himalayan National Park: Located near Kullu, this UNESCO World Heritage Site is home to diverse flora and fauna, including rare species like the snow leopard and Himalayan brown bear."}),`
`]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(a.li,{children:[`

`]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(a.li,{children:[`

`]}),`

`,(0,i.jsxs)(e.li,{children:[`

`,(0,e.jsx)(a.p,{children:"Nainital is a popular hill station located in the Kumaon region of Uttarakhand, India. It is situated at an altitude of approximately 2,084 meters (6,837 feet) above sea level and is renowned for its picturesque beauty, pleasant climate, and serene lakes. The town is named after Naini Lake, a prominent natural freshwater lake in the area. Surrounded by lush green hills, Nainital offers stunning panoramic views of the Himalayas."}),`

`]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(a.li,{children:[`

`]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(a.li,{children:[`

`]}),`

`,(0,e.jsxs)(a.li,{children:[`

`]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(a.li,{children:[`
`,(0,e.jsx)(a.p,{children:"Jagdish Temple: A large Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu, situated near the City Palace. It is known for its intricately carved pillars and sculptures."}),`
`]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(a.li,{children:[`
`,(0,e.jsx)(a.p,{children:"Fateh Sagar Lake: Another picturesque lake in Udaipur, popular for boating and leisure activities."}),`

`,(0,e.jsx)(a.p,{children:"Saheliyon-ki-Bari: A historic garden built for the royal ladies of Udaipur, featuring fountains, marble pavilions, and lush greenery."}),`
